headline: Southern Fried Cabbage
description: Fried cabbage with crispy bacon and onion ‚Äî delicious! This recipe is quick and easy to make for a superb side dish to serve with your favorite roast.

video.description: Bacon and onions add big flavor to a quick-and-easy Southern side dish.
video.name: Southern Fried Cabbage

name: Southern Fried Cabbage
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat; add bacon and season with salt and pepper. Cook until bacon is crisp, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add cabbage, onion, and sugar; cook and stir continuously until cabbage and onion are tender, about 5 to 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I omitted the oil for the bacon. I also didn't add sugar might try it another time when not cooking for my sisters (they're diabetics). As I prepared it it was delicious!
I love this recipe! My cabbage came out Amazing üëèüèæ üíúüíúüíú
Excellent reminded me of my ten years living in South Carolina and the amazing food in that region

I prepared the fried cabbage as the recipe directed and everyone loved it! I took it to a Thanksgiving meal at Church and it was snapped up. It was raved about by all that ate it! I will be making it from now on. It was very easy to make! Oh I did use smoked bacan.
I added a pinch of red pepper flakes for some heat.

My granny made this for years with a twist: ad d ed green pepper minus sugar the pepper adds its own sweetness, also add crushed garlic, and I use half a green cabbage and half a purple for color and taste. Then throw in some mushrooms and it's awesome as a side or even a main dish!! I also use more center cut thick sliced bacon chopped to add more meat! Can't go wrong!! Well worth the minimum a l effort!!
Made several times. My family loves it. I use less oil than the recipe calls for.

I loved this recipe when I saw but I did tweak it it a bit. I used smoked ham hocks instead of bacon. And I also used a stick of butter instead of the cooking oil. And added a tbsp of sugar instead of a pinch. It came out beautifully.
Love fry cabbage
Quick easy and delicious, like my mom use to make.
Didn‚Äôt add the sugar. Very easy and satisfying side dish.
Really a good filling and tasty recipe. Reminded me of my Moms.
I love this have made it for years...I recently have changed it up a bit by adding smoked sausage ,onion, mushrooms very yummy
My family absolutely destroyed this meal. I legit couldn't even get a photo. Followed recipe exact and low and behold, a Southern work of art, I will certainly be having this again very soon
It was wonderful! I added a bit of Chipotle in adobo sauce towards the end to add a smokey spicy touch. Beth
Thanks I think I did great my first time.. appreciate the tip from you!! Time to eat
Easy and delicious
I have been making this for years. I add minced garlic to this.
I added half of a red bell pepper for color. It was delicious!
I added a little balsamic vinegar and an extra couple slices of bacon. It's good and very easy!
Very yummy dish.....I will make it again.I put more bacon in mine..Little hot sauce to boot.
I made mine with more bacon and cooked the cabbage longer. But, oh my heavens, what a wonderful treat! I will have to make this again soon. Yum!
was veery quick and easy to make everybody love it . It is a keeper !!!!!
Delicious! Did not add additional oil, used 6 strips of thick cut bacon.
I took out the onion and sugar nd oil I also added more bacon and then added 2 or 3 mild banana peppers oh wow amazing.
Loved this recipe. Probably won't use the oil next time, or at least a smaller amount.

I add 1 bell pepper, diced. Adds such a tang. I also slow cook my cabbage for an hour. My bacon is cut diced as well, as small as possible. I bake my bacon for about 10 minutes, and let it cook the rest of the way in the cabbage.
Great, just added some garlic, bellpepper and to make it a whole dinner instead of just a side, I added cut up smoke sausage, delicious.
Very good and healthy variation for cabbage. If you ever have too much cabbage this is a great and popular go to recipe.
It was easy, fast, and simple. Oh yeah, and delicious too

Wow - this one's a keeper! Very good! Did adjust slightly because I wanted to use what I had on hand. (and I despise when people change a recipe but I really wanted to use up items in my fridge) I think this is one of those recipes that can be a creative outlet! 

I used about 6-7 slices of bacon, diced fried and set aside, then added at the end. I had 1/2 head of red and 1/2 head of green cabbage so I used both. My only onion was enormous, so I used a large shallot and used up 4 green onions I had on hand along with 2 gloves of garlic I had laying around . S&P and I tossed in a couple tablespoons of brown sugar (Truvia actually - diabetic here, trying not to use sugar) and this is excellent. Thanks so much for sharing! I'll be making this over and over!

I think this would be awesome with the addition of kielbasa or smoked sausage, italian sausage, mushrooms, caraway, etc. But really good as-is!
Instead of bacon I added turkey ham!

Too oily to fry cabbage. It didn't taste that good. Instead will boil the cabbage 15 minutes, then saute. Then saute the opinions, separate from frying the bacon. Add boiled potatoes, then mix all together... I will saute with butter or margarine next time.
I followed the recipe using Chinese cabbage. I think this is my new favorite fried cabbage!
Took the suggestions and omitted extra oil and removed bacon until cabbage fried a bit. I also added my chopped onions first and saut√©d them just a bit before adding cabbage. Turned out excellent!
This is a great, quick recipe for cabbage. I can make this a main dish!

Liked it and will try again. 
I didn‚Äôt cut the cabbage as fine as I should have among other mistakes on my part.
I‚Äôm a New Englander and have never heard of this, but I was intrigued. It is so easy and so tasty! I wish I had a super favorites list, this would be at the top!
I left out the sugar

I followed this recipe as written and it was fabulous! The bacon cooking in the oil is meant to flavor the oil so I wouldn‚Äôt suggest removing it. Instead, I just didn‚Äôt eat the fried bacon. For those who want bacon in the dish, of course add it after cooking but still keep the 3 slices in the oil.

I made the recipe pretty much as directed except I added garlic powder, turmeric, and green peppers to mine. I also used coarse kosher salt and grinded black peppercorns. Note: I normally like adding red pepper flakes and a splash of vinegar (2 cap fulls) to my recipe.

Love this recipe! My parents tend to grow more cabbage than they can eat, so I end up with the extras every summer. This is easy and delicious. I saut√© the onions in the bacon fat for 3 minutes before adding the cabbage, and I cook it until very tender for my kids.
This reminds me of the cabbage my mom would cook for us as a child. Very delicious!!
Made no changes other than adding green onions. Taste great.
I made this today. I had bacon grease so I only used that. I did not add onions, either. Like some others, I cooked it a lot longer stirring frequently with the lid on.
It was easy and delicious! Of course, I added more meat. I added diced ham to my recipe. I had meat in every bite.
Not that good.
I loved it I added sausage instead of bacon and a little more spice
Omitted the onion only. It was delicious!
Great side with a ton of flavor
Loved it
This is a wonderful recipe was fast and delicious husband even though it was good
Very tasty and very easy.

My family loved this recipe! I followed it for the most part but I added smoked beef kielbasa. I also added a tsp more of each salt and pepper. Let it cool about 30 minutes with a lid. We wanted it with very little crispiness. It was excellent ??. Oh, I also added 1/2 tsp of powdered garlic. Highly recommend this recipe! I had never made it before but definitely will again. Thank you so much for posting!!

Easy and great recipe. I did four times the pepper and added 1 TBSP of butter. I also did 2 TBSP of brown sugar instead of regular sugar . Just to make sure it was authentically unhealthy Southern food.

I followed the recipe to the letter the first time I made this. It was way too oily for our tastes, so I tried it again by omitting the oil and adding two slices of bacon. This change turned it into a delicious side dish, and we will be having it again.
Yes!
This is sooooo good! I put my spin on it by adding Soul Food Seasoning, crushed red pepper ( to kick it up), and a bit of brown sugar. YUMMMMMMM
Added 1 minced seeded jalapeno and meat from a boneless smoked ham hock....meaty enough for a main dish with just a slight kick
Added 1 minced seeded jalapeno and meat from a boneless smoked ham hock....meaty enough for a main dish with just a slight kick
The next time I make it I definitely want to add some more bacon and a little less oil

I didnt use bacon because of the fat although i bet its DELICIOUS..I used 3 tsps of liquid smoke and creole seasoning that has salt in it ..plus some red pepper flake. ..charred the out of the cabbage and onion on high heat then a little chicken broth at the end ... still has a bite to the cabbage and onion ..but very good
My husband and I loved this cabbage. It is delicious! Can‚Äôt wait to make this again!!!

I made this it turn out delicious, I cute bacon into bite size pieces. Add some fresh garlic with the onions. My husband Did not want to eat any when I told him what I was making. But it smells so delicious he decides to try some and now he‚Äôs on his second bowl LOL. Definitely would make this again. I only used bacon grease also.

It was nothing spectacular but good comfort food. A great use for my cast iron dutch oven. Much less messy than my skillet. I will just continue to use my own recipe which is whatever I want to put in it with now need to follow a written recipe.
Love it
Followed recipe verbatim and I loved it. Quick simple and delicious. Next time I will add some crispy bacon crumbles.
I love this recipe, cook it all the time@ I don't put onion or sugar in it, but I do put sausage in it and it's a great meal!!
My husband loved it!!
I've made this a couple of times now, using the suggestions others have made. My family and I loved it. A little Scotchbonnet sauce enhance it a bit, but isn't really necessary. Highly recommended.
Fantastic dish and easy to make

I made this according to recipe but I first cooked the bacon, removed the bacon and instead of adding oil, I used the small amount of bacon grease. I also added the bacon at the end and it was nice and crunchy!
And I cooked it for about 10 minutes and it was tender but with some crunch!!

I swapped out the bacon for some leftover ham I had in the freezer. I recommend adding a touch of garlic and cajun seasoning for extra flavor. It's a fave of my husband's and makes the best NYD tradition.
Easy and good
Delicious! Just like my Grandma used to make. I have to make cornbread in an iron skillet to go with it.

I gave this meal 5 stars because I I used the base recipe, but I added my own spin. If you want to make this your entire meal, I would recommend adding sliced kielbasa sausage. I also cooked my onions at the same time as the bacon.
Delicious 4c diced cabbage 1 onion chopped w slices bacon diced 1 tsp sugar
I get bacon crispy before I started the cabbage, extra crispy and 5 strips. I remove half the bacon to use at the time of plating.

This is sooo delicious! I did omit the oil, used extra bacon and instead of adding the bacon back to it, I threw in a smoked sausage and fried it up in bite size pieces. Took that out. Sauteed onions then added the cabbage and sausage into the pan covering it. I stirred it occasionally until the cabbage was tender. I just prefer sausage with cabbage versus bacon. The bacon grease is the only part I used of it. There's nothing better than bacon grease when it comes to certain frying. It was so good!
So good. I used turkey bacon inside of pork. Delicious
loved it!!!

Very good recipe. I left out the oil. The bacon drippings from the bacon is all that was needed. I added about 1/8 teaspoon of sugar to reduce the acidity of the cabbage. I added a pinch of salt and pepper. Perfecto.
This was a very simple dish to make. I added garlic powder and kielbasa sausage to mine. Very flavorful.
This has good flavor even when reheated.
Absolutely delicious! For the two of us, I should have used less than half of a cabbage. The favor was GOOD! The recipe is easy!!
Omg fried cabbage! I‚Äôve had this served at work but this is the first time I‚Äôve made it. Yep going in table for thanksgiving. Great and easy!

Turned out fantastic with a few alterations. Like others I admitted the vegetable oil and removed the bacon after it was cooked. To the cabbage I added about a quarter cup of beer. It gives it a bit of a Bavarian flavor.?
Because I had extra ground beef and ground pork, I added this to the recipe. It came out very well. I found the key is to make sure you core your cabbage correctly

Very greasy and I didn‚Äôt use any oil.
But flavours are good
I made it and it was sooo good! we had bacon for breakfast and we saved the grease and 1/2 of the bacon, Everyone loved it! this was a perfect dish and it got nominated for Thanksgiving!
Yes. Just a little butter
I used bacon bits and the whole family loved this dish. Used the leftovers with eggs for breakfast!
We made it just cooked a lil longer and it was good .
I forgot the sugar! And I added a sprinkling of hot sauce...andit was awesome!
made it just the way they said and it was a fall day spectacular!
Tastiest cabbage I've ever had. This is a new staple in our house! Thanks for sharing.

I did make one change. I decreased the amount of vegetable oil and added a little olive oil. Added more bacon also!!! Mmmm bacon.
So easy to make and absolutely a tasty dish. 
The two of us devoured all of it at dinner.
It is now one of my favorite dishes. The bacon makes this delicious and it is super easy to fix. Great for Keto too.
We add red peppers, mushrooms, and some times shredded carrots to this. Then serve with some garlic shrimp or some smoked sausages.
